body_content.explanation: a tall, deciduous tree (= one that loses its leaves in autumn and grows new ones in the spring) with a very hard wood:
examples: Black locusts are native to the eastern USA and especially Appalachia but are now grown in many different countries.
The bugs are partial to hardwoods - maple, poplar, willow, elm, ash, and black locust.

body_content.explanation: the very hard wood of the black locust tree:
examples: The handrails of the staircase are made from black locust.
The frame of the boat is black locust, ideal because of its strength and durability.
